descriptionHtml:
This little file fixes the incompatibility between Syynxs Perky and the Complete Crafting Overhaul mod caused by the modification of smithing perks. It\'s just a rough fix I put together for personal use, the only thing I did was patch the two perk trees back together. So far, it has only been tested on my system, but no adverse effects so far.

There are two minor issues with this mod. The \"Basic Smithing\" perk is not listed to require it\'s parent, so there are two choices for the first perk you put into the tree, which looks a bit weird. I don\'t think this unbalances things, since the heavy armor path is one perk longer than the light armor one, anyway. Secondly, the armor schematics perks are no longer visible as paths in the tree, they are now accessed by selecting the same perk multiple times.

REQUIREMENTS:
Syynxs Perky: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/12862
Complete Crafting Overhaul: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/8003
 with ALL it\'s prerequisites! (In fact, it\'s not CCO that causes the incompatibility, but the required Smithing Perks Overhaul)

INSTALLATION:
Just copy the .esp file into your data folder

LOAD ORDER:
The only really important thing is that perky is loaded before CCO and it\'s prerequisites, and the patch last of all. My suggestion would be:

Perky
Smithing Perks Overhaul
Weapons and Armor fixes
...
Other crafting stuff
...
Complete Crafting Overhaul
perky_spo_patch

If there are any problems or unforseen sideffects to this patch, let me know. I\'ll see if I can fix it.

Similar patches can be written quite easily for other smithing mods that conflict with perky. Simply load the smithing mod after perky, open them both in the Creation Kit and patch the perk tree back together. The important thing is that most smithing mods use the \"unlock material\" perks, so whatever you do, make sure you\'ve got the smithing mod\'s version of those perks in your perk tree when you\'re done.
author: saerileth
